intro: Paralabatia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered paralabatia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its delicate, small flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are ovate in shape, with a rough texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
